Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.managers

Class CharacterManager

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.managers.Manager
it.polimi.ingsw.model.managers.CharacterManager
public class CharacterManager extends Manager
Contains methods to manage CharacterCard creation and use. To create a CharacterCard randomly, use pickCharacters(int) to get 3 random Character that can be used to instantiate 3 CharacterCards. Pass a CharacterCard to setupCardStorage(CharacterCard, Bag) to insert in the CharacterCard the correct number of StudentDisc. Then you can use the factory method generateAction(CharacterCard) to set the correct Action for the passed CharacterCard.

Normal use method selectCharacterCard(int, int, Map) is called by the Action that is called when a CharacterCard is selected.

  • Method Details

    • pickCharacters

      public ArrayList<Character> pickCharacters(int number)
      Random draws three different Character from the enumeration and returns them in an ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      number - number of characters to draw. Must be from 0 to 12
      Returns:
      three different Character
      See Also:
      • Character

    • setupCardStorage

      public void setupCardStorage(CharacterCard characterCard, Bag bag) throws EmptyBagException, CharacterStudentsStorageFull
      Adds a number of StudentDisc to the CharacterCard. The number is an information available in the CharacterCard and is different for each Character. If the CharacterCard already has Students, this method only fills the storage to match the exact number of students that need to be inside.
      Parameters:
      characterCard - the CharacterCard that will receive the Students drawn from the Bag
      bag - the bag from where the Students will be drawn
      Throws:
      EmptyBagException - if there aren't other Students in the Bag
      CharacterStudentsStorageFull - if you're trying to add other students to a full storage

    • generateAction

      public void generateAction(CharacterCard characterCard) throws NoSuchElementException
      Creates an Effect Action that matches the CharacterCard passed and sets it in the Card. This needs the Action to be generated before calling this method.
      Parameters:
      characterCard - the CharacterCard that receives the Action
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if characterCard is unknown and the method doesn't know which Action is needed

    • selectCharacterCard

      public void selectCharacterCard(int cardId, int playerId, Map<String,String> options) throws NoSuchElementException, TableNotSetException, ActionNotSetException, WrongMessageContentException, RuntimeException, IllegalGameActionException, IllegalGameStateException
      Gets from the table the Card with cardId, and then from the Card, it takes the Action. With this action it checks its id: if its id is contained in the list of the id of the actions in the action manager, then this action is a decorator, and it is placed in the actions list in the action manager. Otherwise, I run this action. If the action is run directly, save the Card (to cardInUse attribute) that is associated with that to allow the Action use the Card storage and set that value to null when the Action has ended.
      Parameters:
      cardId - the id of the requested CharacterCard
      options - the options of the CharacterCard invocation
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if there isn't a CharacterCard in the Table that matches cardId
      TableNotSetException - if table is not set in GameEngine
      ActionNotSetException - if Action is not set in the CharacterCard
      WrongMessageContentException - if there's an exception relative to options map
      RuntimeException - if there's an Exception during Action run
      IllegalGameActionException - if there's an IllegalGameActionException during card act
      IllegalGameStateException - if there's an IllegalGameStateException during card act

    • checkPlayerCanPlayCard

      public boolean checkPlayerCanPlayCard(int playerId, int characterCardId) throws NoSuchElementException, TableNotSetException
      Checks if the player has enough money to use the CharacterCard
      Parameters:
      playerId - the player who wants to play the card
      characterCardId - the cards that the player wants to play
      Returns:
      true if the player can play the card
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if requested player/card could not be found
      TableNotSetException - if table was not set

    • decreasePlayersMoneyEditCardCost

      public void decreasePlayersMoneyEditCardCost(int playerId, int characterCardId) throws NoSuchElementException, NotEnoughCoinException, TableNotSetException
      Decreases player's money of the cost of the character card. If player hasn't enough money, an exception is thrown. This also marks the card as used, to edit its cost.
      Parameters:
      playerId - the player who wants to play the card
      characterCardId - the cards that the player wants to play
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if requested player/card could not be found
      NotEnoughCoinException - if player hasn't enough money to play that card
      TableNotSetException - if table was not set

    • prepareCharacterCardsActions

      public void prepareCharacterCardsActions(List<CharacterCard> characterCards)
      Instantiates the CharacterCards actions.
      Parameters:
      characterCards - the CharacterCards to prepare
